channel.title: Simple question, connection error
channel.description: every client i use for my server has a connection problem, so i know it's something to do with my server. how do i change what the server looks for for a client or what ever...like, how do i fix those problems? what causes them? i don't really know how to explain or ask any better...lol, well thanks for any help. and don't post some dumb shit like use the search bar or something cuz i do and i sucks, i hate smart ass selfish ppl, lol, well yea, peace and thanks again

item.title: Simple question, connection error
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

If I had to guess Id say that your client is the wrong type for that server.

Read full topic

item.title: Simple question, connection error
item.dc:creator: @ILOVEJAVA ILOVEJAVA
item.description:
@ILOVEJAVA wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:2, topic:333523”]Whats the specific message you get when you hit login?
Unexpected Server Response
Error Connecting To Server
No Response From Server

Also, is there anything on the Runserver batch file?[/quote]
the client will start up and say “connecting to server” and just freeze right there, and on the batch file, there is a bunch of stuff. looks like this
Starting server on port: 43594
Connection recieved from: 173.25.91.29
Exception in thread “Thread-0” java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: Bulby/io/
Login : Unsupported major.minor version 8242.8224
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClassCond(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$000(Unknown Source)
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at Bulby.Engine.connectAwaitingPlayers(Engine.java:320)
at Bulby.Engine.run(Engine.java:164)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
Connection recieved from: 173.25.91.29

hope that helps, and thanks for taking time to help me.

Read full topic

@deathschaos9 wrote:

Also, is there anything on the Runserver batch file?
